title: Prohibiting New Investment in and Certain Services to the Russian Federation in Response to Continued Russian Federation Aggression

enrichment.summary: This executive order prohibits U.S. persons from making new investments in Russia and from providing certain services to Russian entities, as part of the U.S. response to ongoing Russian aggression. It also bans transactions designed to evade these prohibitions and allows the Treasury Secretary to enforce and regulate these restrictions.
potential_concerns: U.S. businesses may face difficulties in navigating compliance due to potentially broad or unclear definitions of prohibited services.
The order could lead to unintended economic impacts on allies and multinational companies with cross-border operations involving Russia.
Enforcement challenges may arise due to the complexity of monitoring transactions by foreign persons that involve U.S. persons or interests.
The restrictions might escalate tensions with Russia, potentially provoking retaliatory economic or political measures.
Licensing exceptions and regulatory discretion could create uncertainty for affected parties about what activities are permissible.
